lead_paragraph: The Yankees do not intend to pay Alex Rodriguez a $6 million bonus, but if they did, the luxury tax could make for one and a half times the financial burden.

headline.print_headline: Marketing No. 660 Could Cost Team Double
headline.main: Marketing No. 660 Could Cost Yankees Even More

snippet: The Yankees do not intend to pay Alex Rodriguez a $6 million bonus, but if they did, the luxury tax could make for one and a half times the financial burden.
abstract: New York Yankees remain unlikely to pay Alex Rodriguez $6 million for matching Willie Mays's record of 660 home runs; team would have to pay additional $3 million in luxury-tax for exceeding threshold with payment, adding it to payroll for 2015.
